testimony.name: Michael Sutherland
key_points: Lifting parking mandates will not ban parking, but allow it to be built where appropriate
Many cities across the US have already lifted parking mandates, including less transit-oriented cities
Buffalo's experience shows that lifting parking mandates works, with 47% of major developments including fewer parking spaces than previously required
In New York City, more parking than required has been built in areas with high car dependency
Parking mandates have driven up the cost of building and lowered the number of housing units built in areas with less car dependency
Lifting mandates will allow for more housing creation in areas where parking is unnecessary
Urges the inclusion of parking mandate reform in the City of Yes for Housing Opportunity initiative

quotes.text: Lifting parking mandates will not ban parking from being created. It simply allows parking to be built where it's appropriate
quotes.reasoning: This quote directly aligns with the first two reference talking points about not banning parking and allowing parking to meet neighborhood needs.

quotes.text: Buffalo listed parking mandates as part of a larger zoning reform in 2017. They did so for various reasons, many mirroring the goals of lifting mandates in DHL, spring economic development, enhancing existing walkability, and helping to mitigate the climate crisis.
quotes.reasoning: This quote aligns with the reference point about other cities (specifically mentioning Buffalo) that have ended parking mandates, and touches on benefits like economic development and climate crisis mitigation.

quotes.text: Research has shown that in New York City, more parking than required has been built in areas where there is deep car dependency.
quotes.reasoning: This supports the reference talking point about allowing parking to meet the needs of each neighborhood, suggesting that areas with high car dependency will still have parking built.

quotes.text: Lifting mandates wouldn't ban parking and it wouldn't permit or require less parking to be built anywhere in particular. In fact, in areas where there is high car dependency parking will often still be built. However, in areas where parking is unnecessary or unneeded, lifting mandates will allow the creation of more sorely needed housing.
quotes.reasoning: This quote encapsulates several key points from the reference talking points, including not banning parking, allowing for neighborhood-specific needs, and the potential for creating more housing.
